alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 7:31AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BROWN...SOUTHWESTERN KEWAUNEE...CALUMET...WINNEBAGO...SOUTHEASTERN WAUSHARA...SOUTHEASTERN OUTAGAMIE AND MANITOWOC COUNTIES THROUGH 830 AM CDT... At 729 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Appleton to near Princeton. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Appleton, Oshkosh, Manitowoc, Menasha, Kaukauna, Little Chute, Kimberly, Chilton, Brillion, and Denmark. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized urban flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways, and be alert for the potential for hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Waushara; Winnebago
